Html:
Hi :)
I hope you can help me.
I tried now some days to include your dll into my dll, so that I have only one dll file.
But, I'm not sure what I have to do.

Have you any ideas how to do that? Would be nice if there is an easy way :)

I think the best way is to download the FW1 source and add it to your DLL project, building them both in the same project.

I think you can also set up a solution with the FW1 project building to a static library and then link that into your DLL, but it will probably be more hassle than simply adding all the sources to the same project.

But if I do this:
I think the best way is to download the FW1 source and add it to your DLL project, building them both in the same project.
I have two dll's, right?
Because I want only one dll :)

It should give you only one DLL.
Add the .cpp files from FW1 to a folder in the same VC++ project that you use to build your DLL, instead of using the solution/project from FW1.

ok working now :) Thx.
Had to fix one more problem ;)
